medical_history.chief_complaint: Isolated hypogonadotropic hypogonadism (IHH) associated with micropenis and undescended testes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was noted to have a micropenis and undescended testes at birth. Serum gonadotropins were undetectable at 2 months of age. He showed progressive weight gain and linear growth, but continued to have small penis and testes. Low testosterone response to stimulation was noted around 10 years of age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient exhibits congenital undescended testes and micropenis. Previous endocrine evaluations indicated undetectable basal gonadotropins and a poor response to stimulation tests.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother is heterozygous for the R297L variant and experienced menarche at 11 years of age. No family history of hypogonadism or infertility was reported in the father's siblings.
